definition: to speak conceited nonsense/to come out with arrogant claptrap
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: The ravings are gone to where this is emits hair head fellow in having the audacity mouth .
sentences.chinese: 这是哪里冒出来的毛头小子，竟敢口出狂言。

definition: not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
